activities.name: Louvre Museum Visit
activities.description: Immerse yourself in art and history at the world-renowned Louvre Museum. Focus on key collections like the Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, and Egyptian antiquities. Book tickets online in advance to save time and ensure entry.
activities.location: Musée du Louvre, Rue de Rivoli

activities.name: Explore Covered Passages
activities.description: Escape the rain by wandering through Paris's charming 19th-century covered passages like Galerie Vivienne and Passage des Panoramas. Admire the architecture, browse unique boutiques, and enjoy the cozy atmosphere.

activities.name: Palais Royal Gardens (briefly) & Coffee Break
activities.description: If the rain lightens, take a quick stroll through the Palais Royal gardens. Afterwards, find a cozy cafe nearby for a warm drink and a Parisian pastry.

food_recommendations.restaurant: Le Fumoir (near Louvre) or a quick sandwich shop
food_recommendations.dish: Croque Monsieur or a gourmet sandwich
Classic French bistro fare like Steak Frites or Duck Confit

itinerary.title: Day 2: Impressionist Art & Gothic Stained Glass

activities.name: Musée d'Orsay Visit
activities.description: Housed in a former railway station, this museum boasts an impressive collection of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces by artists like Monet, Van Gogh, and Renoir. Book tickets online.
activities.location: Musée d'Orsay, Rue de la Légion d'Honneur

activities.name: Sainte-Chapelle
activities.description: Marvel at the breathtaking stained-glass windows of Sainte-Chapelle on Île de la Cité. This royal chapel is a stunning example of Gothic architecture and provides a magnificent indoor experience.

activities.name: Île de la Cité Exploration & Notre Dame Exterior
activities.description: Walk around Île de la Cité, viewing the exterior of Notre Dame Cathedral and exploring the charming island. Seek shelter in a nearby bookshop or small gallery if the rain is heavy.
activities.location: Île de la Cité / Notre Dame Cathedral

food_recommendations.restaurant: L'As du Fallafel (Le Marais) or a casual brasserie
food_recommendations.dish: Falafel sandwich or a simple plat du jour

to_destination.tips: Book flights (e.g., EasyJet, Ryanair) or train tickets (e.g., TGV, Thalys) well in advance for the best prices. Consider arriving at smaller airports like Beauvais (BVA) for budget airlines, but factor in shuttle costs to Paris.

local_transport.tips: Purchase a 'carnet' of 10 T+ tickets for 17.35 EUR (approx. $18.80 USD) for better value. Validate your ticket each time you enter the metro or board a bus. The Metro is efficient and ideal for navigating Paris, especially on rainy days. Wear comfortable, waterproof shoes.

travel_tips: **Weather Preparedness:** With rain expected, pack a good quality waterproof jacket, an umbrella, and comfortable waterproof walking shoes. Layers are recommended as temperatures can vary.
**Book in Advance:** For popular attractions like the Louvre and Musée d'Orsay, booking tickets online in advance is crucial to save time and avoid long queues, especially on rainy days.

**Budget-Friendly Food:** Take advantage of local boulangeries for affordable breakfast pastries and coffee. For lunch, grab a sandwich, crêpe, or falafel from street vendors or small cafes. Consider supermarkets for picnic supplies or dinner options to save money.
**Local Transport:** The Paris Metro is extensive and efficient. Purchase a 'carnet' of 10 tickets for convenience and savings. It's the best way to get around, especially when the weather is bad.
**Stay Hydrated:** Carry a reusable water bottle; many cafes and public fountains can refill it.
**Safety:** Be aware of your surroundings, especially in crowded tourist areas and on public transport. Keep an eye on your belongings to prevent pickpocketing.
